授業目的:
In this course, will look at environmental problems, and the responses to them by different governments around the world, with special focus on the EU.
This course will raise your awareness of the many impacts our consumption has around the world. It helps you understand how globalised our world is.
You will learn responses against environmental problems by governments, NGOs, citizens and companies, and analyse their effectiveness.
到達目標:
Over the course, you will acquire or improve the following skills:
Critical, independent thinking; environmental awareness; evaluation of policies and actions; academic writing skills; discussion skills
特記事項:
この科目は、4/28（木）までの授業がオンデマンドで実施される科目です。
5/2（月）以降の授業は対面での実施が決定しました。本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course will be offered on-demand until Thursday, April 28.
Classes will be held in a face-to-face format from Monday, May 2 onward.
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This course is designed as VE (virtual exchange) class. You will have several tasks to complete with students from the University of Oxford and LMU (Munich University). Active participation and critical thinking is a must.
